required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacoeconomic Consequences Of Analgesia in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open Label, Multicentre Study to Compare the Pharmaco-economic Implications of an Analgesia Based Regimen With Remifentanil and a Conventional Sedation Based Regimen Using Propofol in Medical and Post-surgical ICU Subjects Requiring Mechanical Ventilation for at Least 2 Days.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be a multicentre randomized, open-label, phase IIIb study. This study will evaluate two different techniques of sedation: an analgesia based regimen with remifentanil versus a conventional sedation based regimen using propofol in subjects that require mechanical ventilation for at least 2 days in the ICU. The conventional sedation based regimen will consist of propofol combined with an opioid according to routine clinical practice (morphine, fentanyl, sufentanil or other as required) . The analgesia based regimen will consist of remifentanil, with propofol added on if required.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time on Mechanical Ventilation (Intent-to-Treat Population)
primary_outcome.description: Time from start of mechanical ventilation until actual extubation (the process of removing a tube from the airway).

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time on Mechanical Ventilation (Modified-Intent-to-Treat Population)
primary_outcome.description: Time from start of mechanical ventilation until actual extubation.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time on Mechanical Ventilation (Per-Protocol Population)
primary_outcome.description: Time from start of mechanical ventilation until actual extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time in Intensive Care Unit (ICU) and Potential Stay in ICU (the Time Expected for Extubation, i.e., the Time Between Intubation and Eligibility for Extubation, According to Investigator's Decision)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of Intensive Care Unit (ICU) stay and the duration of potential stay in the ICU were measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of extubation was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Weaning
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of weaning (the time from the intubation until the recovery of natural respiratory ability) was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Remifentanil Infusion (ITT Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from the infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Propofol Infusion (ITT Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from the infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from the infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose of Remifentanil Administered - Continuous Infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Dose of Propofol Administered - Bolus
secondary_outcome.description: Data from this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Dose of Fentanil Administered - Bolus
secondary_outcome.description: Data for this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Analyzed for Sedation - Agitation Scale (SAS) and Pain Intensity (PI) Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Data from participants in the study for which the Sedation-Agitation Scale (SAS) and Pain Intensity (PI) were recorded were analyzed. "Sedation - Agitation" was assessed, using the "Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale" (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable. "Pain Intensity" was assessed by the following 6-point Pain Intensity Scale: 1, no pain; 2, mild pain; 3, moderate pain; 4, severe pain; 5 very severe pain; 6, worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sedation-Agitation From Screening Through the End of Study
secondary_outcome.description: "Sedation - Agitation" was assessed, using the "Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale" (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sedation-Agitation for Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: "Sedation - Agitation" was assessed, using the "Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale" (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sedation-Agitation From Day 8 to Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: "Sedation - Agitation" was assessed, using the "Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale" (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Analyzed for BIS (Bispectral Index Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants in the study for which BIS were evaluated. The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bispectral Index (BIS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through End of Study, up to 38 days
secondary_outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Day 5
secondary_outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Extubation Period and Post-Extubation Period
secondary_outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity (PI)
secondary_outcome.description: "Pain Intensity" was assessed by the following 6-point Pain Intensity Scale: 1, no pain; 2, mild pain; 3, moderate pain; 4, severe pain; 5 very severe pain; 6, worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity From Day 8 to Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: "Pain Intensity" was assessed by the following 6-point Pain Intensity Scale: 1, no pain; 2, mild pain; 3, moderate pain; 4, severe pain; 5 very severe pain; 6, worst possible pain.

intervention.description: analgesia in medical and post-surgical Intensive Care Unit subjects requiring mechanical ventilation
conventional sedation in medical and post-surgical Intensive Care Unit subjects requiring mechanical

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical and post-surgical patients admitted to ICU and requiring mechanical ventilation.
- Intubated subjects expected to require mechanical ventilation for longer than 48 hours after starting the study drug.
- Subjects requiring both analgesia and sedation with a regimen comprising a hypnotic agent and an opioid.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis: cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in the previous 24 hours or expecting to require major surgery within the next three days
- Subject who, in the judgement of the investigator, has a life expectancy of 2 days or refrained or refuses full life support, which would limit the care provided
- Concurrent medications:
- Requires or is likely to require neuromuscular blocking agents by continuous infusion to facilitate mechanical ventilation
- Has or is likely to receive an epidural block during the treatment period

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

group.title: Propofol
group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. group.title: Propofol
group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Simplified acute physiology score (SAPS II) score
measure.description: The SAPS II score consists of adding the points from 17 variables: age, 12 physiological variables, type of admission, and 3 chronic disease variables. These variables are added to give a SAPS II score with a range of 0 ("predicted mortality" 0%) to 163 ("predicted mortality" 100%). SAPS II data were collected from local laboratories for 24 hours following ICU admission.

group.title: Propofol
group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

measure.title: Total Dose of Fentanil Administered - Bolus
measure.description: Data for this measure come from infusion pump display; the infusion pump infuses medication (analgesics and sedative agents) into the participant's circulatory system.
measure.population: ITT Population. Only participants dosed with Fentanil were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Analyzed for Sedation – Agitation Scale (SAS) and Pain Intensity (PI) Scale
outcome.description: Data from participants in the study for which the Sedation–Agitation Scale (SAS) and Pain Intensity (PI) were recorded were analyzed. “Sedation - Agitation” was assessed, using the “Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale” (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable. “Pain Intensity” was assessed by the following 6-point Pain Intensity Scale: 1, no pain; 2, mild pain; 3, moderate pain; 4, severe pain; 5 very severe pain; 6, worst possible pain.
outcome.population: mITT Population

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

group.title: Propofol
group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

measure.title: Sedation-Agitation From Day 8 to Day 10
measure.description: “Sedation - Agitation” was assessed, using the “Riker Sedation-Agitation Scale” (SAS), by the following 7-point scale: 7, dangerous agitation; 6, very agitated; 5, agitated; 4, calm, cooperative; 3, sedated; 2, very sedated; 1, unarousable.
measure.population: mITT Population according to the participants’ status

outcome.title: Number of Participants Analyzed for BIS (Bispectral Index Scale)
outcome.description: Participants in the study for which BIS were evaluated. The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
outcome.population: mITT Population

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

group.title: Propofol
group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

measure.title: Number of Participants Analyzed for BIS (Bispectral Index Scale)
measure.description: Participants in the study for which BIS were evaluated. The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
measure.population: mITT Population

outcome.title: Bispectral Index (BIS)
outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
outcome.time_frame: Screening through End of Study, up to 38 days
outcome.population: mITT Population. Due to the nonmandatory nature of BIS measure in the clinical practice, some participants did not have all the measures for all days in which they were in the study.

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per killograms per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

measure.title: Bispectral Index (BIS)
measure.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
measure.population: mITT Population. Due to the nonmandatory nature of BIS measure in the clinical practice, some participants did not have all the measures for all days in which they were in the study.

outcome.title: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Day 5
outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
outcome.population: mITT Population. At Day 5, only one participant remained in the study; the others were already extubated.

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

measure.title: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Day 5
measure.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
measure.population: mITT Population. At Day 5, only one participant remained in the study; the others were already extubated.

outcome.title: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Extubation Period and Post-Extubation Period
outcome.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
outcome.population: mITT Population. The BIS value was recorded only for 2 participants, in the extubation and post-extubation periods.

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

group.description: The administration of propofol combined with an opioid (fentanyl, sufentanil, morphine, or other) as required to maintain adequate analgesia/sedation and stable haemodynamics was performed according to routine clinical practice for the investigational site, and in accordance with standard clinical protocols.

measure.title: Bispectral Index (BIS) for Extubation Period and Post-Extubation Period
measure.description: The BIS monitor provides a single dimensionless number, the BIS value, which ranges from 0 to 100. A BIS value of 0 equals electroencephalogram silence, near 100 is the expected value in a fully awake adult, and between 40 and 60 indicates a level for general anaesthesia.
measure.population: mITT Population. The BIS value was recorded only for 2 participants, in the extubation and post-extubation periods.

outcome.title: Pain Intensity (PI)
outcome.description: “Pain Intensity” was assessed by the following 6-point Pain Intensity Scale: 1, no pain; 2, mild pain; 3, moderate pain; 4, severe pain; 5 very severe pain; 6, worst possible pain.
outcome.population: ITT Population, according to the participants' status. Participants remained in the study until they could be extubated; thus, the number of participants analyzed may vary by day.

group.title: Remifentanil
group.description: Infusion started between 6 and 9 ug/kg/h (micrograms per kilogram per hour), and titrated in 1.5 ug/kg/h increments at 5-10 minute intervals to achieve a level of adequate sedation based on investigator clinical judgement. The maximum dose rate was 45 ug/kg/h. Once the remifentanil infusion rate reached 12 ug/kg/h, the sedative infusion (propofol) could be administered if level of sedation was not adequate.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
